plant.summary: Contains insoluble calcium oxalate crystals that cause intense burning and irritation of the mouth, tongue, and lips in cats. While rarely fatal, it causes significant discomfort.
plant.what_to_do:
**Mild to moderate emergencyâ€”seek veterinary care.**

1. Rinse your catâ€™s mouth gently with water (do not force).
2. Offer a small amount of milk or tuna water to soothe irritation.
3. Call your vet for adviceâ€”most cases resolve with supportive care.
4. Watch for breathing difficulty (rare but serious).

> ğŸ’¡ Pro tip: Keep Monsteras on high shelvesâ€”theyâ€™re climbers and love to drape!

plant.contentHtml: âš ï¸ Disclaimer: PawSafePlants provides general educational information only. This content is not veterinary advice. If your cat has been exposed to any plant, contact a licensed veterinarian or the ASPCA Animal Poison Control Center immediately. We do not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or timeliness of this information. Use at your own risk.
